data.title: Masood Ahmad
meta_keywords: Research in the field of Science & Technology
data.text:
Visiting Faculty

Department of City and Regional Planning

Profile

AREAS OF EXPERTISE AND COMPETENCE

Strong expertise in Urban Environmental Management (UEM) to include strategies for urbanization challanges such as Urban Sprawl, Urban Heat Island Effect (UHIE), Density Regulations, Urban Slums, and environmental degradation;

Highly skilled in Environmentl Impact Assessment (EIA) projects to include baseline studies, Sensitivity Mapping, Analyses of Alternatives (AA), assessment of impacts, identification of mitigation measures and Environmental Management Plan (EMP);

Vast experience in Master Planning to include studies for Multan Master Plan, Sialkot Master Plan, Quetta Master Plan, critical review of Lahore Master Plan and Outline Development Plans (ODPs) for Secondary Cities;

Extensive experience of donor funded projects to include World Bank (WB), European Union (EU), German Technical Cooperation (GTZ), UNEP, ADB, and Dutch Embassy;

Demonstrated experience in planning/designing of Site and Services (S&S) projects;

Sound project management skills strengthened through managing various projects involving multi-stakeholders and interdisciplinary teams of professionals; and

Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills sharpened by interaction at various levels, and making written and oral

Job Experience

Sustainable Cities Initiative – City of Richmond Hill, Canada

Worked for the ‘Sustainable Cities’ project of Engineering and Public Works Department of Richmond Hill City on various plans such as ‘Smart growth program’, Downtown Intensification projects/‘Infill Studies’, Brownfield development, Urban Public Spaces, Zoning and Re-development Studies’, Environmental Protection to reduce ‘Urban Heat Island Effect’

Multan Structure Plan – a World Bank project

Worked for the World Bank-funded Multan Master/Structure Plan on the following:

Need assessment studies, baseline, landuse, and traffic surveys

Data analyses and result interpretation

Upgradation of squatter settlements and and strategies to prevent future slums

Identification and evaluation of future growth corridors

Findings, conclusions, and recommendations

Housing, Physical and Environmental Planning Department

Worked for a number of Outline Development Plans (ODPs) for Secondary Cities to include Landuse studies, Transportation surveys, Socioeconomic surveys including stakeholder perception studies, Townscape and landscape studies, designations for residentiary, commercial, educational, recreational, industrial, transport terminals, and community services

Urban Improvement/Flood Protection – EU Project

Carried out Socio-Environmental Assessment (SEA) of EU-Funded Jhelum Infrastructure Development and Flood Protection Project to include baseline socioeconomic and demographic studies, economic activity/employment patterns, literacy levels, health status, culture and heritage, history and archaeology. This also included community perception on the proposed development

Waste Management Program – a GTZ project

Conducted Socio-Environmental studies for GTZ-Funded waste management project to include waste inventories, review of collection, handling, storage/disposal practices, and field studies for site selection of MSW landfill. This also included environmental protection measures for air quality, odor, spill prevention and soil/groundwater protection

Sind Katchi Abadis Development Program – ADB

Coordinated data collection/analysis and report writing for ADB-funded Sind Katchi Abadis Development Program to include preparation of survey tools (questionnaires, checklists, structured interviews etc.), Physical, socio-economic, industrial, and institutional surveys, Data analysis and result interpretation, findings, conclusions and recommendations for new infrastructure development

Ministry of Housing, Oman

Conducted environmental assessment studies for housing project to include institutional need assessment, baseline studies, identification of Action Areas for development interventions such as Brownfield Development, Downtown Intensification, Land Subdivision, waste management, traffic studies, and recommendations for Urban Design/Urban Renewal

National Environmental Consulting (NEC) Lahore

Conducted demographic and socioeconomic studies for Dutch-Funded Environmental Technology Program (ETP) to include survey tools, project flyers, posters, background documents, fact sheets, media briefings etc., community meetings to include ‘open houses’, ‘focus groups’, ‘one-on-one meetings’, ‘postal questionnaires’, ‘focus group discussions’, Data analyses/result interpretation, findings, conclusions and recommendation.

Employment History

Aug 2016 till date: Independent Consultant, Toronto, Canada Oct 2006-Jun 2016: Manager: AETS Muscat/Toronto, Canada

Sep 2004-Sep 2006: Environmental Coordinator: City of Richmond Hill, Canada Apr 2002-Aug 2004 Environmental Consultant: AiMS Consulting, Canada

Apr 1996-Sep 2000: Senior Reviewer: ETP, Lahore Feb 1994-Mar 1996: EIA Specialist: NEC, Lahore

Feb 1990-Feb 1992: Assistant Director: Housing, Physical and Environmental Planning Department, Lahore

Academic Qualifications

B.Sc. City & Regional Planning, University of Engineering and Technology (UET), Lahore

M.Sc. Human Settlements Development (HSD), School of Environment, Resources and Development, AIT Bangkok

Master of Environmental Studies (MES), York University Toronto

Achievements, Trainings, Memberships

York University Graduate Award - 2000

CIDA Masters Scholarship

Highest Standing and Gold Medal (Urban Environmental Management)

Lead Auditor ISO 14001-based EMS-2015

Certified HSE Practitioner

Member Ontario Association for Impact Assessment (OAIA)

‘Lead Participant’ at International Conference on Mega Cities: Bangkok

Resource Person at WWF/IUCN workshop on Environmental Management

Certified SPSS Analyst: Toronto

Resource Person at EPA/UNEP worksjop on EIA Guidelines

Resource Person at Rotary International workshops on Traffic and Transportation Planning
